description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Windows themes spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-21320), various security updates are available that should be applied to affected systems:

1. Download and install the relevant update package from the Microsoft Update Catalog based on your system configuration:
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5034122](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034122)
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 (x64): [KB5034123](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034123)
   - For Windows Server 2016: [KB5034119](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034119)
   - For Windows Server 2022: [KB5034129](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034129)

2. Restart your system after the installation to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
- This issue could allow an attacker to spoof themes, leading to potential UI/UX manipulation. 
- Ensure that your system is compliant with the latest Microsoft support policies.
- System configurations that have disabled NTLM authentication are not affected by this vulnerability.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is running a compatible version of Windows as specified in the updates.
- Backup important data before proceeding with the updates to avoid data loss.
